answers.answer: I have type 2 diabetes, what you are describing happens to me when my sugar gets too low.  I was on too much medication, now I am not on enough.  I hope you find out what it is for you, Good luck, Dee
not on any meds as of now, trying diet first'

Having sudden fatigue, dizzyness and/or getting light headed could stem from being either hypoglycemia [low blood sugar] or hyperglycemia [high blood sugar]. BP is good so that is a plus.If your morning fasting levels are "100 to 115" you're considered impaired with prediabetes. Your A1c of 6.4% converts to an estimated daily glucose average of 137 mg/dl, high and in diabetes land. Better control of your blood sugars are needed by watching what you eat, drinks, lose excess weight [congrats on the 15lb loss], and perform daily 30-60 minutes of exercise."eat something on break, feel a little better, then 1 hour later start feeling diizzie light headed like, just real out of it."Eating foods high in carbohydrates [which turn into sugar rapidly] will cause a sudden sugar crash. What was it that you ate? Eating a proper diabetic diet low in carbohydrates is extremely important with avoiding having weird health symptoms.For diabetes analysis it is important to check your blood sugars at the proper times. Testing postprandial - 2 to 3 hrs after meal - provides an insight on how the foods you consumed affect your blood sugars. Your goal is to be at normal levels, 60/70 to 99 mg/dl. Type 2 diabetics on the other hand aim for <141 mg/dl, better yet <121 mg/dl. Testing earlier or later than the 2-3 hr window doesn't provide an accurate insight of your levels. If you can do this and also able test when you feel irregular it will provide us with better insight to help you further. Good luck -
Thanks for the comment, I ate a can of chicken noddle soap. It was about 2 hours later I checked my surger and got 115. Again thanks for the help am new at this diabetes stuff, but I am learning.

You're welcome. A can of chicken noodle soup is relatively low in carbs and sugar but way out of bounds on sodium. A sodium imbalance may cause a vertigo sensation.Feel free to ask questions. I was once in you place too with tons of questions circling my brain. This forum is here to help answer those questions and concerns.

question: Recently found out I have type 11 diabetes, 3 month blood test came back at 6.4., Been watching what  I eat and lost 15 pounds so far. Check blood in the morning and  is usally at 100 to 115, in the afternoon after work its at 75 to 90. I am 54 years old, now the question, this just happen yesterday but happens every once in a while.  wake  for work just feeling overly tired, get to work feeling out of it, eat something on break, feel a little better, then 1 hour later start feeling diizzie light headed like, just real out of it. went home checked my blood suger it was 115,  blood preasure was 117/77, palse was 70', like I said this happens once every couple of weeks, is this related to the diabetes or something else. ( heart related ) thanks for the help
title: out of it light headed
